intro: Musgravea, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a short, thick stem and produces showy, often fragrant blooms during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in hot, dry environments. Musgravea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-maintenance, drought-tolerant gardens.
